definitions.definition: Obstinately refusing to give up or let go .
examples: She has had a persistent cough for weeks.
There was a persistent knocking on the door.
There have been persistent rumours for years.

definitions.definition: Lasting past maturity without falling off.
Of data or a data structure : not transient or temporary , but remaining in existence after the termination of the program that creates it.
examples: Once written to a disk file, the data becomes persistent : it will still be there tomorrow when we run the next program.

definitions.definition: Describing a fractal process that has a positive Brown function

definitions.label_groups: mathematics , stochastic processes , of a state

main_definition: Obstinately refusing to give up or let go .

( computing ) Of data or a data structure : not transient or temporary , but remaining in existence after the termination of the program that creates it.

( mathematics , stochastic processes , of a state ) non- transient .
